definitions.definition: An alcoholic, often sparkling (carbonated) beverage made from fermented apples; hard cider; apple cider

A non-alcoholic still beverage consisting of the juice of early-harvest apples, usually unfiltered and still containing pulp; apple cider; sweet cider (without pulp such a beverage is called apple juice).
definitions.example: She liked an aged cider. He liked a harder cider.

definitions.definition: A non-alcoholic carbonated beverage made from apples.
(in Korea) A non-alcoholic drink, normally carbonated; equivalent to soft drink.
A cup, glass or serving of any of these beverages.
One who toasts (cooks lightly by browning).
One who toasts (engages in salute while drinking alcohol).
A toasting fork.
A rapier or similar weapon.
An electrical device for toasting bread, English muffins, crumpets, etc.
A self-contained software package (or appliance) distributable over the Internet or by burning onto CDs.
An electronic organ, especially a crude one that uses analog technology.
Any of several small, box-like automobiles exemplified by the Scion xB and Honda Element.
A fish ready for toasting.
A firearm, especially a pistol.
One who shuts or closes something.
(usually in the plural) Protective panels, usually wooden, placed over windows to block out the light.
The part of a camera, normally closed, that opens for a controlled period of time to let light in when taking a picture.
To close shutters covering.
definitions.example: Shutter the windows: there's a storm coming!

definitions.definition: To close up (a building) for a prolonged period of inoccupancy.
definitions.example: It took all day to shutter the cabin now that the season has ended.

definitions.definition: To cancel or terminate.
definitions.example: The US is seeking to get Iran to shutter its nuclear weapons program.

definitions.definition: A band of fabric, inside the crown of a hat, designed to absorb perspiration.
A band of fabric worn around the wrist or head during sports to absorb perspiration.
Full of virtue, having excellent moral character.
definitions.example: Successful communities need strong, selfless leaders and a virtuous people.

definitions.definition: Paid for in advance
To pay in advance, or beforehand
definitions.example: to prepay phone credit

definitions.definition: A year.
The northernmost point on celestial bodies other than Earth.
The positive pole of a magnetic dipole that seeks geographic north.
A forehand or backhand shot that is executed after the ball has bounced once on the court.
To spend more than some limit or than another entity.
definitions.example: Statistics show that political candidates who greatly outspend their opponents win more frequently.

definitions.definition: (in the plural) The duties or taxes imposed on imported or exported goods.
definitions.example: Customs of £200 were due on all the wine we took back from France.

definitions.definition: (in the singular) The government department or agency that is authorised to collect the taxes imposed on imported goods.
definitions.example: Customs has pulled us over on our way for an inspection.

definitions.definition: Frequent repetition of the same behavior; way of behavior common to many; ordinary manner; habitual practice; method of doing, living or behaving.
Traditional beliefs or rituals
definitions.example: The Ancient Egyptian culture had many distinctive and interesting beliefs and customs.

definitions.definition: Habitual buying of goods; practice of frequenting, as a shop, factory, etc., for making purchases or giving orders; business support.
Long-established practice, considered as unwritten law, and resting for authority on long consent; usage. See Usage, and Prescription.
Familiar acquaintance; familiarity.
Toll, tax, or tribute.
To make familiar; to accustom.
To supply with customers.
To pay the customs of.
To have a custom.
To succeed; to prosper, be lucky.
To help someone, to give them fortune; to aid or favour.
definitions.example: God speed, until we meet again.

definitions.definition: To go fast.
definitions.example: The Ferrari was speeding along the road.

definitions.definition: To exceed the speed limit.
definitions.example: Why do you speed when the road is so icy?

definitions.definition: To increase the rate at which something occurs.
To be under the influence of stimulant drugs, especially amphetamines.
To be expedient.
To hurry to destruction; to put an end to; to ruin.
To wish success or good fortune to, in any undertaking, especially in setting out upon a journey.
To cause to make haste; to dispatch with celerity; to drive at full speed; hence, to hasten; to hurry.
To hasten to a conclusion; to expedite.
(Instance of) acceleration.
Driving faster than the legal speed limit.
definitions.example: He was fined $100 for speeding.

definitions.definition: Travelling very fast; moving at speed.
Specifically, travelling at an illegal speed (of vehicles, motorists).
definitions.example: We were overtaken on the inside by a speeding motorcyclist.

definitions.definition: Under the influence of the drug speed; high on amphetamines.
A funeral pile; a combustible heap on which corpses are burned.
Any heap or pile of combustibles.
Cranky, disagreeable, or stubborn, especially if prone to odd whims or fancies.
To withdraw; especially of military forces; to retreat.
definitions.example: The mayor pulled out of the race for Senate after numerous opinion polls had him polling at less than 10 percent.

definitions.definition: To use coitus interruptus as a method of birth control.
definitions.example: With a tremendous groan, he pulled out and ejaculated all over her belly.

definitions.definition: To remove something from a container.
definitions.example: He pulled his gun out before she had a chance to scream.

definitions.definition: To maneuver a vehicle from the side of a road onto the lane.
definitions.example: When joining a road, you should check for traffic before pulling out.

definitions.definition: To draw out or lengthen.
An infectious disease of humans and animals caused by the bacteria Listeria monocytogenes and Listeria ivanovii, often through contaminated food.
One who regularly goes to church; a practicing Christian.
A supposed ailment caused by prolonged watching of television or computer screens.
Cousin (usually as a term of address)
Because
An extensive waste covered with patches of heath, and having a poor, light soil, but sometimes marshy, and abounding in peat; a heath
definitions.example: A cold, biting wind blew across the moor, and the travellers hastened their step.

definitions.definition: A game preserve consisting of moorland.
To cast anchor or become fastened.
To fix or secure (e.g. a vessel) in a particular place by casting anchor, or by fastening with ropes, cables or chains or the like
definitions.example: the vessel was moored in the stream

definitions.definition: To secure or fix firmly.
To rejoice; to be very happy, especially in triumph.
A small electrical appliance for drying hair, by generating a stream of hot air.
A vacation spent at or close to home.
To spend a vacation at or close to home.
In a theological manner.
Concerning theological matters.
Having both eyes oriented inward, especially involuntarily.
Any of several therapies involving the insertion of genes into a patient's cells in order to replace defective ones.
To have a strong desire or ambition to achieve something.
definitions.example: He aspires to become a successful doctor.

definitions.definition: To go as high as, to reach the top of (something).
To move upward; to be very tall.
Aspiration.
Hoping to become.
definitions.example: Aspiring pop stars lined up for hours just to audition.

definitions.definition: To leave; to begin a journey or trip.
definitions.example: He set off in search of better opportunities.

definitions.definition: To begin; to cause; to initiate.
definitions.example: I had no idea that one simple comment would set off such a huge argument.

definitions.definition: To cause to explode, let off.
definitions.example: What a tragedy, that someone would set off a bomb in a crowded place.

definitions.definition: To make angry.
definitions.example: Don't set him off or he won't shut up all day.

definitions.definition: To enhance by emphasizing differences.
definitions.example: Her plain white dress was set off by a bright red stole.

definitions.definition: To offset, to compensate for: to reduce the effect of, by having a contrary effect.
definitions.example: My taxes did not increase because the amount of my raise was set off by my losses in the stock market.

definitions.definition: To deface or soil the next sheet; said of the ink on a freshly printed sheet, when another sheet comes in contact with it before it has had time to dry.
The private part of an Arab household, traditionally forbidden to male strangers.
A group of someone's girlfriends, wives and/or concubines in a polygamous household.

A group of female animals (cows) herded and controlled by a male animal (bull) of that species for breeding purposes. Such behaviour is exhibited by bovids including cattle and buffalo as well as moose, elephants, seals, sea lions, baboons, and elephant seals.
Any significant number of women together as a group; a bevy.
A genre of anime and manga in which a man is the love interest of three or more women.
A device, object, contrivance or machine used to produce musical notes or sounds.
A surname.
A given name common in a family, or already borne by someone in the family (in the context of naming someone in the family after that family member).
Something which relieves (pain, etc.).
A relief pitcher.
definitions.example: The first reliever got the last two outs of the sixth.

definitions.definition: Someone who fills in for another.
definitions.example: I'll be the reliever today so that you can each take a break.

definitions.definition: A garment kept for being lent out.
UK army rank with NATO code OR-6, senior to corporal and junior to warrant officer ranks.
The highest rank of noncommissioned officer in some non-naval military forces and police.
A lawyer of the highest rank, equivalent to the doctor of civil law.
A title sometimes given to the servants of the sovereign.
definitions.example: sergeant surgeon, i.e. a servant, or attendant, surgeon

definitions.definition: A fish, the cobia.
Any of various nymphalid butterflies of the of the genus Athyma; distinguished from the false sergeants.
A bailiff.
A servant in monastic offices.
A melodic theme associated with a particular character, place, thing or idea in an opera.
A recurring theme.
A tool used to remove material so as to create a hole, typically by plunging a rotating cutting bit into a stationary workpiece.
definitions.example: Wear safety glasses when operating an electric drill.

definitions.definition: The portion of a drilling tool that drives the bit.
definitions.example: Use a drill with a wire brush to remove any rust or buildup.

definitions.definition: An activity done as an exercise or practice (especially a military exercise), particularly in preparation for some possible future event or occurrence.
definitions.example: Regular fire drills can ensure that everyone knows how to exit safely in an emergency.

definitions.definition: Any of several molluscs, of the genus Urosalpinx, especially the oyster drill (Urosalpinx cinerea), that drill holes in the shells of other animals.
A style of trap music with gritty, violent lyrics, originating on the South Side of Chicago.
To create (a hole) by removing material with a drill (tool).
definitions.example: Drill a small hole to start the screw in the right direction.

definitions.definition: To practice, especially in (or as in) a military context.
definitions.example: They drilled daily to learn the routine exactly.

definitions.definition: To cause to drill (practice); to train in military arts.
definitions.example: The sergeant was up by 6:00 every morning, drilling his troops.

definitions.definition: To repeat an idea frequently in order to encourage someone to remember it.
definitions.example: The instructor drilled into us the importance of reading the instructions.

definitions.definition: To investigate or examine something in more detail or at a different level
definitions.example: Drill deeper and you may find the underlying assumptions faulty.

definitions.definition: To hit or kick with a lot of power.
To hit someone with a pitch, especially in an intentional context.
To have sexual intercourse with; to penetrate.
An agricultural implement for making holes for sowing seed, and sometimes so formed as to contain seeds and drop them into the hole made.
A light furrow or channel made to put seed into, when sowing.
A row of seed sown in a furrow.
To sow (seeds) by dribbling them along a furrow or in a row.
A small trickling stream; a rill.
To cause to flow in drills or rills or by trickling; to drain by trickling.
definitions.example: waters drilled through a sandy stratum

definitions.definition: To entice or allure; to decoy; with on.
To cause to slip or waste away by degrees.
An Old World monkey of West Africa, Mandrillus leucophaeus, similar in appearance to the mandrill, but lacking the colorful face.
A strong, durable cotton fabric with a strong bias (diagonal) in the weave.
An unborn or unhatched vertebrate showing signs of the mature animal.
A human embryo after the eighth week of gestation.
definitions.example: The sequence is: molecules in reproductive systems, then gametes, zygotes, morulas, blastocysts, and then fetuses.

definitions.definition: An amount or length measured in yards.
The use of a yard, or the fee charged for it.
Territory.
Tough and courageous; having balls.
An ideology based on the belief that people, goods and information ought to be able to cross national borders unfettered.
A socio-economic system dedicated to free trade and free access to markets.
A botched or incompetently handled situation.
To botch up, bumble or incompetently perform a task; to make or mend clumsily; to manage awkwardly.
The pear-shaped fruit of a small tree of the rose family, Cydonia oblonga.
The deciduous tree bearing such fruit, native to Asia.
A soft yellow colour, like that of a quince.
Mutual good, shared by more than one.
A tract of land in common ownership; common land.
The people; the community.

The right of taking a profit in the land of another, in common either with the owner or with other persons; so called from the community of interest which arises between the claimant of the right and the owner of the soil, or between the claimants and other commoners entitled to the same right.
To communicate (something).
To converse, talk.
To have sex.
To participate.
To have a joint right with others in common ground.
To board together; to eat at a table in common.
A dining hall, usually at a college or university.
A central section of (usually an older) town, designated as a shared area, a common.
definitions.example: The Renaissance festival started with the "peasants" meeting in the commons.

definitions.definition: The mutual good of all; the abstract concept of resources shared by more than one, for example air, water, information.
definitions.example: "The tragedy of the commons" is that none wish to make sacrifices of their or their family's interests for the common good.

definitions.definition: An outhouse.
(Oxford University) Food served at a fixed rate from the college buttery, distinguished from battels.
Food in general; rations.
Someone with a lean, only slightly muscular body
: Theoretical body type in which a person has a high metabolism. Such a person can easily maintain a low fat physique, but does not add muscle or body weight easily.
An accounting period of one year, not necessarily coinciding with the calendar year.
definitions.example: New York State has rarely had an approved budget by the beginning of its April 1 fiscal year

definitions.definition: An assumption made beforehand; a preliminary conjecture or speculation.
The act of presupposing.
An assumption or belief implicit in an utterance or other use of language.
A cheap showy ornament piece of jewellery; a gewgaw.
A club or sceptre carried by a jester.
A small shiny spherical decoration, commonly put on Christmas trees.

Part of the human brain involved in emotion, motivation, and emotional association with memory; includes amygdala, cingulate gyrus, fornicate gyrus, hippocampus, hypothalamus, mammillary body, nucleus accumbens, orbitofrontal cortex and parahippocampal gyrus.
To warn or notify of a fault; to reprove gently or kindly, but seriously; to exhort.
To counsel against wrong practices; to caution or advise; to warn against danger or an offense; — followed by of, against, or a subordinate clause.
To instruct or direct; to inform; to notify.
A table or similar flat-topped structure used for religious rites.
A raised area around an altar in a church; the sanctuary.
Anything that is worshipped or sacrificed to.
A lively Spanish dance in 3/4 time; also an unrelated slower-tempo dance of Cuban origin, in 2/4 time.
A type of short, buttonless jacket or blouse, open or tied in front and ending at the diaphragm.
To dance the bolero.
One one-thousandth of a second. Symbol: ms.
Representation of a concept through symbols or underlying meanings of objects or qualities.
A combining together of parts or ingredients.
To stop liking or supporting someone; to become unfriendly towards.
definitions.example: He took against me when I was promoted over him.

definitions.definition: A montage of short video clips, usually from a film or TV series, illustrating a particular repeated element such as a word or phrase.
A type of women's shoe having a strap behind the heel or ankle
Of or pertaining to tension.
Capable of being stretched; ductile.
A medium-sized dog of a breed that is a cross between bulldog and terrier.
A type of beet whose root contains a high concentration of sucrose.
Belief in the existence of at least one deity.

(narrowly) Belief in the existence of a personal creator god, goddess, gods and/or goddesses present and active in the governance and organization of the world and the universe. The God may be known by or through revelation.
A morbid condition resulting from excessive consumption of tea.
A member of the Royal Military Police a unit in the British army.
A porter in a US railway station.
The European goldfinch (Carduelis carduelis).
A type of evil goblin or imp.
A breed of poultry.
definitions.example: Red Cap: A rare member of the English class, these are characterized by having a large rose comb. They are one of the few breeds with red earlobes that lay white-shelled eggs. Content: Chicken Breeds and Varieties (A2880), John L. Skinner, University of Wisconsin-Madison https//web.archive.org/web/20060907060926/http://www.ansi.okstate.edu/poultry/chickens/redcap/

definitions.definition: A variety of artichoke, Cynara cardunculus cultivated for food.
(of a person) calm, relaxed, casual and informal
(of a journey or pace) unhurried
The bone joining the shoulder and the breastbone.
(parts of New England) The main street of any town.
Mainstream shops, banks, etc. that can be found on such a street, in contrast to more specialist shops and services.
Physical, bricks and mortar shops, in contrast to Internet shops.
An action in which principles are compromised for financial gain.
A person who compromises his or her principles for financial gain.
definitions.example: The rock star used to be hardcore, but now he's just a sellout.

definitions.definition: The selling of an entire stock of something, especially tickets for an entertainment or sports event.
definitions.example: The game was a sellout.

definitions.definition: In parliamentary forms of government, the branches of government that are not military, legislative, or judicial, but work to apply its laws and regulations.
The body of civilian employees of any level of government, not subject to political appointment and removal, normally hired and promoted largely on the basis of competitive examination.
definitions.example: He's got a steady job in the civil service.

definitions.definition: Sheet pan, baking tray
A ringlike band of muscle that surrounds a bodily opening, constricting and relaxing as required for normal physiological functioning.
definitions.example: the iris sphincter in the eye

definitions.definition: Any of several flowers in the genus Lilium of the family Liliaceae, which includes a great many ornamental species.
Any of several species of herbaceous flower which may or may not resemble the genus Lilium in some way, and which are not closely related to it or each other.
The flower used as a heraldic charge; also commonly used to describe the fleur-de-lis.
The end of a compass needle that should point north, traditionally often ornamented with the figure of a lily or fleur-de-lis.
(usually in the plural) A royal spade in auction bridge.
The thirtieth Lenormand card, representing calmness and maturity.
White (as a racial epithet).
Something wrecked, especially the remains or debris of something which has been severely damaged or destroyed.
One of the main three types used for the Latin alphabet (the others being italics and blackletter), in which the ascenders are mostly straight.
A novel.
(of type) upright, as opposed to italic
(of text) of or related to the Latin alphabet
Healthy; vital; in good health, particularly in opposition to unfavorable circumstances.
A metrical foot in verse consisting of an unstressed syllable followed by a stressed syllable.
To make (something, especially meat) tender.
A brace, band, or clasp for strengthening or holding things together.
An instrument used to temporarily shut off blood vessels, etc.
A parking enforcement device used to immobilise a car until it can be towed or a fine is paid; a wheel clamp.
A mass of bricks heaped up to be burned; or of ore for roasting, or of coal coking.
A pile of root vegetables stored under a layer of earth.
A piece of wood (batten) across the grain of a board end to keep it flat, as in a breadboard.
An electronic circuit that fixes either the positive or the negative peak excursions of a signal to a defined value by shifting its DC value.
To fasten in place or together with (or as if with) a clamp.
To hold or grip tightly.
To modify (a numeric value) so it lies within a specific range.
To cover (vegetables, etc.) with earth.
A heavy footstep; a tramp.
To tread heavily or clumsily; to clump or clomp.
Education beyond compulsory schooling, not including university-based higher education.
